name: Museo Archeologico di Aidone
description: Superbly displayed and comprehensive collection of archaeological material from the site of Morgantina

name: Museo Archeologico Regionale di Centuripe
description: An excellent and comprehensive display of archaeological material from Centuripe and the surrounding area

name: Museo Civico Alessi
description: CURRENTLY CLOSED

name: Museo Archeologico Varisano
description: A medium-sized collection from sites in the surrounding area (Calascibetta, Capodarso, Cozzo Matrice, Enna, Rossomanno, Assoro, Pietraperzia, Agira).

name: Museo Enzo Cammarata
description: A private collection of antique furniture (principally French) and objets d'art of various cultures and periods, displayed in a restored summer house overlooking the Villa del Casale. The owner, Baron Cammarata del Casale, owns the land on which the Roman villa was found. There are numerous beautiful pieces in the many rooms of the museum, and they include a few Roman sculptures and a red-figure Krater (acquired recently during the auction of Versace's collection). The celebrated coin collection was not on display at the time of visit

location.address: Villa delle Meraviglie, S.P.15, Contrada Casale, 94015 - Piazza Armerina (EN)

name: Biblioteca Comunale / Museo Archeologico
description: The major part of the collection previously on display here was removed by the Soprintendente and will form part of the collection in the new Piazza Armerina Archaeological Museum. They are left with 2 small display cases: 1 with medieval to early modern pottery; 1 with some ancient pottery including part of a red figure vase. Just a few ancient ceramics in total, but housed in a beautiful ex-Jesuit monastery that is now the communal library

name: Museo del Territorio e della Citt� di Piazza Armerina
description: Date of opening as yet unkown

location.address: Palazzo Trigona, Piazza Duomo 20, 94015 - Piazza Armerina (EN)

name: Antiquarium Comunale (gia carcere mandamentale)
description: The collection derives entirely from excavations in Contrada Marcato and consists of Neolithic and Bronze Age material, then a break before late Hellenistic, Roman, Byzantine and Arabic material. 10-12 cases in total, neatly displayed with nice signboards

name: Museo Archeologico di Caltanissetta
description: A comprehensive collection from much of the province of Caltanissetta (principally Sabucina, Gibil Gabib, Polizzello, Capodarso, Vassallaggi, Desueri) from settlements, sanctuaries, necropoleis and chance finds. Amazing bronze material and some superb red and black figure vases. The material ranges in date from the Bronze Age to the Byzantine period

name: Museo Archeologico Regionale di Gela
description: Arranged over two floors, the lower floor is devoted to a geographically organised exhibit of material from the site of Gela, and includes some marvellous pieces. The upper floor is split into several discrete sections. A comprehensive display of the coins is preceded by the famous altars found in Bosco Littorale, and a pi-shaped corridor begins with material from the enormous Thesmophorion at Contrada Bitelemi and then runs through material from the territory around Gela in chronological order from prehistory to the Greeks, Romans and Byzantines

name: Museo Archeologico Regionale di Marianopoli
description: The collection contains material principally deriving from 3 sites (Valle Oscura, Monte Balate and Monte Castellazzo). The red and black figure pottery is given prominence in most rooms, although there is a nice display of 3 stele (2 inscribed). The finds date principally to the 6th-4th Centuries BC (mainly from Castellazzo, presumed to be ancient Mytistraton), with a first room of prehistoric material

location.address: Via delle Regione Siciliana, 93010 - Marianopoli (CL) (sign boards in town still indicate the old museum, vacated in 2012)

name: Antiquarium Comunale Arturo Petix
description: A newly built 2-floor antiquarium with ample study and storage space below. An amazing prehistoric collection is beautifully displayed. All from the surrounding area, mostly excavated by V LaRosa. A varied and beautifully preserved collection, complemented by an upper floor of well-chosen later material (7th century BC through to the Arabic period)

name: Castello di Butera
description: When visited in July 2015 the museum was closed due to structural problems. It was still closed in June 2016.

name: Area Archeologica e Antiquarium iconografico di Sabucina
description: Has been closed for many years due to structural problems. All of the material previously displayed here is now in the museum of Caltanissetta. It is currently uncertain if this antiquarium will reopen

name: Antiquarium Archeologico Comunale
description: The collection was opened in 2012, in a restored palace, and has been very neatly presented. The finds come principally from Polizzello and Monte Raffe, with later material from the town of Mussomeli itself. The prehistoric and Iron Age material from Polizzello is complemented by the 5th and 4th centuries BC material from Monte Raffe. NB some of the items on display are copies of objects currently held in other collections (e.g. Palermo, Caltanissetta)

name: Museo Regionale Archeologico di Catania
description: Used mainly for temporary exhibitions; it does not yet have any permanent collection of its own. Currently closed

location.address: Ex Manifattura Tabacchi, Via Garibaldi, 95120 - Catania (CT)

name: Teatro Romano di Catania
description: Small antiquarium with finds from the site, principally sculpture with some architectural elements

location.address: Greek-Roman Theatre, Via Vittorio Emanuele 266, 95124 - Catania (CT)

name: Museo Civico di Catania
description: Antiquarian collection, comprehensive in scope

location.address: Castello Ursino, Piazza Federico II di Svevia, 95121 Catania (CT)

name: Museo di Archeologia dell'Universita di Catania
description: This museum is principally formed around the personal collection of Libertini, augmented by donations from Paolo Orsi and other individuals. The majority of the material seems to derive from Catania and Centuripe, but there are also finds from Megara Hyblaia and many have no clear provenance (Libertini frequently purchased on the antiquities market, as well as collecting from his own excavations). The ceramics range from prehistoric to medieval, supplemented by inscriptions, antefixes, terracotta altars, strigils, figurines, pinakes and a number of fakes. A great teaching collection

name: Museo Archeologico Paolo Vagliasindi
description: A small collection of finds from sites in the local area, including some beautiful bronzes, a nice coin collection, black painted 5th C Attic, 6th C Corinthian, 6-5th C Ionian, some Hellenistic and some excellent black and red figure attic

name: Museo Archeologico Regionale di Adrano
description: A superb local collection in an 11th century castle with excellent views of Etna and the plain of Catania. Neolithic and Bronze age material from various sites in the area; 8th-5th century material (indigenous and Greek) principally from Mendolito; 4-2 C BC material (principally ceramic), Roman sculpture, amphorae etc. The upper floors have modern weapons, paintings and letters.

name: Antiquarium e museo civico di Aci Castello
description: A very small collection with superb Stentinello pottery, amphorae and anchors (plus fossils and a mineralogical collection)

name: Museo Civico Corrado Tamburino Merlini
description: Small collection of material from sites in the local area, amply covering Neolithic-Bronze-Archaic periods. A few classical and hellenistic-roman pieces, with a nice amphora collection (excellent preservation) and an excellent epigraphic section

name: Museo Civico Archeologico di Ramacca
description: Small collection of material from sites in the local area, covering Neolithic-Bronze-Archaic-Classical-Roman periods with some lovely pieces. Excellently displayed

name: Museo Archeologico
description: A neatly-displayed collection of material from the excavations at Contrada Terravecchia. Mainly ceramics of 10th-6th centuries BC

location.address: Piazza Carlo Maria Carafa, palazzo comunale, 95042 - Grammichele (CT)

name: Sala espositiva, area archeologica delle Mura dionigiane di Adrano
description: A small collection of finds from this site was displayed in a renovated 1-room building next to the walls. These were removed to the Castle in Adrano due to safety considerations. The only pieces remaining in June 2015 were some kiln wasters

name: Museo Civico Luigi Sturzo
description: A very small collection, mostly of sherds (some prehistoric, some archaic) with a few carved blocks (e.g. an Aeolic capital)

name: Museo della Ceramica
description: A superb collection of ceramics (with a few stone objects) from prehistoric to modern times. Neatly displayed. Much material from the locality, but also from other sites in Sicily (e.g. Agrigento, Sciacca). The majority of the collection is medieval-modern

name: Antiquarium di Palike
description: A single room with 12 display cases containing finds exclusively from the site of Palike, organised chronologically. Predominantly archaic and classical, but extending from Paleolithic to Medieval. A wide range of material, from painted architectural pieces to ceramics, metal objects (including a writing stylus), terraccotta figurines etc.

name: Museo Civico Antonino di Vita
description: Several display cases containing well-ordered and very well-lit pieces, mainly ceramics but with some metal and silver objects. Starts with a few cases of Neolithic and Eneolithic objects, passes to 7th century and then classical and hellenistic pieces. Nothing that is much later. The objects all come from necropoleis in the area of Licodia Eubea and excavations carried out in the town itself

name: Museo Archeologico, del Risorgimento, e pinacoteca Zelantea
description: A small antiquarian collection with some ceramics (strong in oil lamps), a lovely spearhead, 2 axe blades, a bust possibly of Julius Caesar, some inscribed stamps (metal), and a few figurines (both metal and terracotta)

location.address: Via Marchese di San Giuliano 17, 95024 - Aci Reale

name: Museo del Mare
description: CURRENTLY CLOSED. It had a small collection of antiquities collected by local fishermen, mainly amphorae, with some anchors, but there was at least one bronze age vessel.

location.address: Piazza Ognina 14,17, 95100 - Via dei Conzari 18 - Ognina (CT)

name: Antiquarium di Santa Venera al Pozzo
description: Unknown

name: Museo Civico Archeologico Prospero Grasso
description: Beautifully displayed small museum, very well-lit with good descriptions and a well-arranged collection. It begins with a geographical and chronological overview, continues with a focus on the house of the pithos that was excavated and is on display in the archaeological park, then the necropolis, then the later periods (a single small case). Material mainly from 6-4 Century BC, with some later (terra sigillata and arabic) and some earlier (3rd millenium BC). All from sites in the immediate surrounding area

location.address: Via Papa Giovanni XXIII, 95040 - Castel di Judica (CT)

name: Collezione Archeologica nascosta nella Villa Manganelli Biscari di Viagrande
description: An eclectic collection of antiquities, ranging from large architectural pieces (marble columns, column capitals, architraves) through sculpture (bronze and marble) and ceramics (red figure, black figure, Centuripe ware, numerous shapes, sizes, many fragments, including some superb pieces) to small finds (a great collection of strigils and fibulae) and coins. This was part of the collection of Prince Ignazio Biscari, and was in the house when the current owner bought it sight unseen in 1968. He has permission from the state to retain the collection, and it is recognised as being in his private ownership. The collection is partly in the villa itself, and partly in the gardens and a series of purpose-built structures. The archaeological collection is mixed in with a vast collection amassed by the owner (principally art and sculpture of more modern periods, and weaponry)

location.address: Villa Manganelli Biscari di Viagrande, Via Garibaldi 303, Viagrande (CT)

name: Museo Civico Salvo Nibali
description: Neatly displayed collection of primarily neolithic material (Diana culture) but also some 6th and 5th century BC Greek material (possibly extending into the 4th century BC). The material mainly derives from Bolze Soprane, Edera and the Tartaraci cave

name: Museo della Ganzaria
description: A very small collection of primarily very fragmentary ceramics, with just one nearly complete cup from the San Cono Piano Notaro culture found in the centre of town. The finds cover the Neolithic to Arabic period, and are neatly displayed. They were all found in surface survey in the surrounding area, or were recovered from excavations in the area

location.address: Via dei Greci 35, 95040 - San Michele di Ganzaria (CT)

name: Museo Civico Gaetano Savasta
description: A small series of display cases containing material from Neolithic to recent times, from excavations in the local area: San Marco, Poggio Monaco, Monte Castellaccio, Poggio Cocola and the Collina Storica. Principally ceramics, with some small finds

location.address: Piazza Martiri d�Ungheria 1, ex Carcere Borbonico, 95047 - Patern� (CT)

name: Museo Archeologico di Giardini Naxos
description: An excellent collection of archaeological material from the site of Naxos and the surrounding area, with a particular focus on the temples and on the amphorae and anchors recovered from the sea.

name: Museo Archeologico Regionale Eoliano "Luigi Bernab� Brea"
description: The enormous collection is displayed in several neighbouring buildings, each with a particular focus: Prehistory, Prehistory of the minor islands, Epigraphy, Geology, the Classical period and later. The finds come from across the Aeolian islands, under the sea that surrounds them, and from the site of Milazzo on Sicily. One of the 3 largest Sicilian collections, it is truly comprehensive in scope and contains a few finds (e.g. the terracotta tragic theatre masks) that are near unique

name: Museo Civico-Archeologico
description: A small collection of material excavated between 1979 and 2004 (all material excavated previously is in the Paolo Orsi). Mainly 6-5th century BC from the necropoleis and a sanctuary of Demeter, but also a small domestic quarter. Mostly ceramic with some nice pinakes (similar to those from Lokri)

name: Antiquarium Domenico Ryolo
description: A medium sized collection dedicated to finds from excavations in Milazzo, mainly from the cemeteries, but also from the inhabited area. A nice prehistoric collection, but the focus is primarily on the 5-4BC to 2,3,4 AD. The ancient tuna vertebrae are given pride of place in one of the rooms.

name: Antiquarium del Duomo Antico
description: A small room is dedicated to objects found during the excavations and restoration projects in the Castle of Milazzo. Mainly ceramics and coins with some glass ware. Mainly later, e.g. Norman, Swabian, but there is Byzantine material and at least 1 Roman coin

name: Antiquarium di Tindari
description: This collection is dedicated to material excavated at the site of Tindaris, organised by type rather than chronology: ceramics, statues, inscriptions, glass ware and a reconstruction of the scaenae-frons

name: Antiquarium e sito archeologico di Halaesa
description: Excellent display of material from the site, including lovely sculpture and a superb epigraphic collection

location.address: Contrada santa maria delle palate, 98079 - Tusa (ME)

name: Museo della cultura e delle Arti Figurative Bizantine e Normanne
description: A beautiful collection in a converted church, mainly consisting of stray finds from around town. An excellent epigraphic collection and some material from wells excavated when the church was converted. A highlight is a so-called Kotabos stand

name: Museo Civico alla Badia
description: A converted church with a panoramic view over the surrounding area. A very small collection focused on the mosaics from the Roman villa found at Halaesa, accompanied by info boards from a recent exhibition

name: Antiquarium e scavi della villa Romana di Marina di Patti
description: A small building on the site, dedicated to the excavations at the villa, with very good explanatory boards. Coin collection (going as far back as 4BC), inscriptions, marble decorative elements, small finds, ceramics, and photos of the excavations while they were being carried out.

name: Antiquarium di Capo d'Orlando
description: Dedicated to the finds from Capo d'Orlando itself, it begins chronologically with some Ausonian period pottery (from the foot of the Madonna mountain in the town), but is mainly dedicated to the finds from the bathhouse of the Villa Bagnoli

location.address: Via Del Fanciullo 2 (ingresso via Nino Mancari), 98071 - Capo D'Orlando (ME)

name: Museo Civico Polivalente
description: The museum moved from Via Monte 1 in 2010, and is now housed in a recently restored palace built by the Tasca D'Almerita family. The archaeological collection is displayed in random order, with few labels or descriptions. Late material is mixed with early, and although there are a few cases with fragmentary ceramics of various periods and two coins, the focus is on various stones (some architectural, some not).

location.address: Palazzo della Cultura (Palazzo Mastrogiovanni Tasca), Corso Umberto, 1, 98073 Mistretta ME, Italy

name: Museo Archeologico Bernab� Brea, sezione di Filicudi
description: A 2-floor building next to the port hosts an ethnographic collection on the ground floor (farming equipment, mill-stones and ship-models) and an archaeological collection on the upper, which is divided into four rooms containing inscriptions, column capitals, pottery and some underwater finds, many of which have been recovered by sport divers, together with some information panels about the sites on the island.

name: Museo Archeologico Bernabo Brea, sezione di Panarea
description: The collection consists of 2 rooms in a lower-ground floor building. The first contains some small finds and models, the material is predominantly prehistoric. The second room contains some amphorae and an anchor from shipwrecks off Panarea and two inscriptions mounted on the walls

name: Antiquarium di Palazzo Zanca
description: The collection consists of 3 rooms lined with cases, all deriving from the excavations in the internal courtyard of Palazzo Zanca. They begin with the most recent material and progress to the earliest. The material largely dates to the 11-15 centuries AD, but a large Roman public building of monumental construction was uncovered in the earliest layer reached. A single case is devoted to this period, with 9 groups of artefacts in it (fragments of amphora, terra sigilata, crustae, mosaic flooring). Excellent information boards throughout

location.address: Palazzo Zanca, Piazza del Municipio, 98122 - Messina (ME)

name: Antiquarium del Teatro Antico
description: The collection in the "Casina degli Inglesi" consists of 20 inscriptions, 1 statue, two busts, a few mosaics, a 2nd C AD marble sarcophagus and some modern art

name: Casa Cuseni (Casa-Museo)
description: A lovely collection, only part of which is archaeological. When Robert Kitson built the place he excavated into the rock and uncovered a cistern (possibly ancient) and the remains of ancient inhabitation, some of which were subsequently built into his garden features. There are loomweights, ceramics and other small finds, mixed in with a lovely collection of modern art. No provenance given for any of the ancient material, although it is understood to all be from Taormina

name: Museo Archeologico Regionale Antonino Salinas
description: Partially reopened following extensive restoration work. Comprehensive collection of archaeological material, predominantly from the West of the island, with an important Etruscan collection.

location.address: Centre of Palermo, Piazza Olivella 24, 90100 - Palermo

name: Fondazione Banco di Sicilia
description: Superb collection of predominantly ceramic material from Western Sicily. Much from excavations sponsored by the bank, some purchased on the antiquities market, and some loaned by the archaeological authorities in Western Sicily

location.address: Palazzo Branciforte, Via Bara all'Olivella 2, 90133 - Palermo

name: Museo Civico Baldassare Romano
description: A large and well-displayed collection. It begins with three ante-rooms, in the first of which is a rich display of lithics (mainly Neolithic) from the surrounding area. A display of material from Himera (lion-head spouts from the Temple of Victory and red-figure craters being the principle pieces) and a numismatic gallery then follow before the main room which contains Hellenistic and Roman material from Termini Imerese itself. Small finds, sculpture and inscriptions predominate. The museum collection continues upstairs with non-archaeological material (and a single inscription). The courtyard of the building holds a large collection of architectural pieces and inscriptions

location.address: Via Marco Tullio Cicerone, 90018 - Termini Imerese (PA)

name: Parco Archeologico di Himera e Antiquarium
description: Excellent collection of archaeological material from the site of Himera and the surrounding area (in particular Settefrati and Cefalu) arranged according to find spot

location.address: Contrada Buonfornello - Termini Imerese (PA) On the hill above the temple

name: Museo Mandralisca
description: An idiosyncratic collection of archaeological material, including some famous pieces. Mainly Attic red and black figure

name: Antiquarium Case d'Alia
description: A two-floor structure, with the public buildings displayed on the ground floor (theatre, temple of Aphrodite, bouleuterion) and the private buildings on the upper floor (archaic house c.500 BC), hellenistic houses, Roman house. Excellent displays of ceramics, tiles, small finds, architectural pieces. Many terracotta inscriptions, and 2 Greek stone inscriptions + 2 Arabic ones

location.address: Contrada Perciana San Cipirello - Monreale (PA) At start of road up to archaeological site of Monte Iato

name: Area Archeologica e Antiquarium di Solunto
description: There are two museum buildings at the site. The first, at the entrance, gives an overview of the site and its excavations, then treats some of the individual buildings and areas within the site. The inscriptions are here (from the theatre). The second, at the exit, contains the small finds, and begins with the archaic (indigenous and punic layers), then moves to the Hellenistic and Roman periods. There are numerous ceramics, some sculpture, some wall paintings and mosaics

location.address: Via Collegio Romano, 90017 - Solunto Santa Flavia (PA)

name: Museo Francesco Mina Palumbo
description: A mixed collection including geological, archaeological and naturalistic samples (a taxidermy collection dominates, together with a section on the collection of Manna and some lovely fossils). The archaeological collection consists of unprovenanced sporadic finds from the Madonie, mainly worked stone blades (Obsidian dominates), displayed in paper cartons, with some Roman lamps and glass ware. 2 Punic(?) amphorae and 1 anchor stock.

name: Collegio dei Gesuiti
description: The museum presents material from a Hellenistic necropolis excavated to the east of Polizzi Generosa. It is arranged across two floors, with the upper being stratigraphic and the lower typological. The lower floor was closed for repair when visited. The material in the upper floor is organised by the 5 phases identified during excavation (2nd quarter of 4th century BC to end of 2nd century BC). The material is mainly ceramic (pottery and terracotta figurines), with some astragaloi, strigils, jewellery (rings, fibulae etc)

name: Museo Civico Nicolo Barbato
description: This is an ethnographic collection, very nicely done, of great interest, but contains no ancient archaeological material

location.address: Via Padre Giorgio Guzzetta, 90037 - Piano degli Albanesi (PA)

name: Biblioteca Comunale/Antiquarium Comunale
description: A large room on the 2nd floor of the building, it contains a wealth of material from sites in the territory of Partinico (which was once much larger than it is now). It is mostly fragmentary, principally ceramic (with an unusual amount of stamped amphorae and tiles). Some glass finds, a number of lithics, a few coins, and 2 fragments of Latin inscriptions

location.address: Corso dei Mille - Palazzo del Carmine 90047 - Partinico (PA)

name: Museo Civico Palazzo D'Aumale
description: A small archaeological section within a much larger museum with large sections on shells, fish, ornithology, carts and early modern and modern art. The archaeological section is devoted to finds made on the adjacent seabed, consisting mainly of amphorae

location.address: Palazzo D'aumale lungomare Peppino Impastato, 90049 - Terrasini

name: Museo Regionale della Valle dell'Eleuterio
description: The museum is dedicated to the site of Makella (ancient Marineo) and the sites in the adjoining valley, the ancient Eleutherios (principally Monte Porcara, Pizzo Cannita and Sant'Agata - a Late Roman cemetery). The museum is located in the castle, and uses the large high rooms to great effect. The collection begins with an overview of the excavation and history of exploration of the area, then covers the surrounding sites and moves chronologically and thematically (selections on every day life, religion, warfare) through the site of Makella itself, finishing with displays on the Medieval period and the process of transforming the ruined castle into the present museum. Further rooms have just been renovated and will be opened shortly to host further parts of the archaeological collection

name: Museo Civico
description: A well organised museum consisting of a large ground-floor room and a courtyard. Copious descriptive panels in the first room accompany the objects found during excavation work carried out here (at the site of Hippana). The main room consists of finds donated to the museum by local benefactors, mainly (it seems) from the necropolis. Predominantly ceramics, although the excavation material also has slingshots, arrow heads etc. from the destruction of the site. The courtyard hosts some carved stone pieces, including one that is inscribed with at least 2 lines of Greek

name: Museo Archeologico/Antiquarium Comunale di Entella
description: The museum is arranged both chronologically and thematically, with sections on the early inhabitation of the region and the medieval period bracketing thematic sections on the Entella tablets, the granary, the necropolis, the coins and the inscriptions

name: Museo Civico Pippo Rizzo
description: Arranged across 2 floors and a series of rooms, the upper floor follows a chronological arrangement beginning with the Neolithic and Bronze Age, the 5-4 century BC site of Montagna Vecchia, then some Hellenistic and Roman finds (including the famous milestone). The lower floor is a lapidarium with some reconstructed pithoi. Several columns and architrave pieces come from 2 Roman peristyle houses

name: Museo Archeologico Ustica
description: Unknown

name: Museo Civico della Cultura Artigiana e Contadina
description: CLOSED. Not expected to reopen

name: Antiquarium dei bagni di Cefala Diana
description: The archaeological material recovered in excavations in the courtyard of the complex will eventually be displayed in a museum in one of the wings of the current building, but there is as yet no date for its opening

location.address: Strada Provinciale 189, presso bivio di Baucinae di Bolognetta, 90030 - Cefala Diana (PA)

name: Museo Civico Filipo Meli
description: The archaeological collection is currently in storage prior to display in the Civic Museum. No date has yet been set for its opening

name: Museo Archeologico Multimediale della Tonnara dell'Orso
Museo Civico di Gangi
description: The archaeological collection is arranged in 4 rooms on the ground floor, and is mainly devoted to 6th and 5th century BC material from the surrounding area. There is some Roman material (principally oil lamps and the 3 inscriptions). One room is entirely focused on the site of Monte Alburchia (from which the 3 inscriptions originate)

name: Museo Archeologico
description: Currently closed, no date set for reopening

location.address: Via Vittorio Emanuele III 52, 90025 - Lercara Friddi

name: Museo Civico di Montelepre
description: Exhibition was formed in the early 2000s from chance finds in the area of the necropolis of Hykana (identification not yet confirmed) dating from 7th to 4th centuries BC. The location of the settlement site is not yet clear. The Soprintendenza became involved to stop the Tombaroli and took the material gathered to the Salinas, from which it was returned to Montelepre when a sufficient space was allocated for it. Nicely exhibited, a lovely collection in a series of cases. Principally ceramic, in good condition, some lithic finds.

location.address: Torre Ventimiglia, Vai della Torre 1, 90040 - Montelepre (PA)

name: Museo del Territorio
description: Closed. Not expected to reopen

name: Museo Civico Antonio Collisani
description: A well-displayed and well-lit collection of miscellaneous material collected by Colisano, who lived in Petralia (died in 1990) and collected from across the island. Some has a provenance (Selinunte, Bagheria, Kamarina) but most is "provenance unknown". It has a wide scope, from Neolithic through Bronze age, and plenty of material from the Archaic, Classical, Hellenistic and Roman periods. There are coins, ceramics, terracotta sculptures and bronzes. There is a comprehensive display on the Grotta del Vecchiuzzo (which Colisano rediscovered)

name: Museo Archeologico Ibleo
description: Comprehensive collection of archaeological material discovered in the province of Ragusa, with a particular focus on the sites of Kaukana, Kamarina, Castiglione and Monte Casasia

name: Polimuseo Attilio Zarino
description: A small but relatively rich collection of material from the area around Vittoria. Some are labelled as being from Camarina, some from closer to the museum. There is an inscription, some pottery, some coins and a few other miscellaneous objects. The collection has been declared and gifted to the state, and it is hoped that it will soon be moved to a building designed specifically for it

name: Museo Archeologico Regionale di Kamarina
description: Comprehensive collection of archaeological material discovered at the site of Kamarina

name: Museo Archeologico Belgiorno
description: Excellent collection of archaeological material from Modica and the surrounding area - as far as Scicli - with one or more cases devoted to each site. A lot of prehistoric material, some classical and Byzantine, and a good faunal collection (including shark teeth found near Modica) Very well arranged and organised, across a series of rooms. The undisputed highlight is the bronze Herakles of Cafeo

name: Antiquarium del Parco della Forza
description: The small collection is held in a cave on the site, with 4 display cases (2 ancient; 2 Norman). The ancient material includes Castellucio pottery, Licodia Eubea phase pottery from the 8th century, and some material from the Archaic to Hellenistic periods. There is then a chronological break before the Norman material. Some nice medieval church pieces and 2 x 17th century AD inscriptions

name: Museo Civico di Monterosso Almo
description: 3 display cases contain material exclusively from Monte Casasia, with excellent descriptive boards. Displayed in a beautiful palazzo together with an ornithological collection, they have an agreement with the Soprintendenza to augment the collection with numerous other pieces currently in storage in Ragusa. The best material from this site will, however, remain on display in Ragusa museum

name: Museo Archeologico Regionale Paolo Orsi
description: An outstanding collection of archaeological material. The collection ranges from Siracusa and the surrounding territory (Megara Hyblaia, Akrai, Kasmenai etc) to encompass all of eastern Sicily, reaching as far as Gela and Agrigento. The ground floor covers prehistory through to the end of the Classical period. Upstairs includes Hellenistic and Roman Syracuse and a display of material from the catacombs. A gallery displaying material from Hellenistic eastern Sicily is in preparation.

name: Galleria regionale di Palazzo Bellomo
description: An excellent art museum: Room 1 contains some material dated to the 6th century AD

name: Artemision: Il tempio Ionico
description: A small collection of architectural pieces recovered from the Temple.

name: Museo Civico di Noto
description: The museum was damaged in an earthquake and all the ancient archaeological material was sent to the Paolo Orsi for safe keeping. They have not yet been returned and the collection currently consists of stones from various medieval buildings, some medieval armour and weaponry, and 2 ancient inscribed blocks

name: Antiquarium di Akrai
description: Tiny collection of objects from the site, particularly the temple, together with models and explanatory boards

location.address: Site of Akrai,Colle dell'Acromonte, 96010 - Palazzolo Acreide (SR)

name: Museo Archeologico Gabriele Judica
description: This museum displays the part of the Barone Judica collection that was previously in Lentini. Mostly unprovenanced, it is well-displayed in a well-restored building. Mostly thought to come from Akrai itself. The ceramics are of good quality, but heavily abraded. 6 stone inscriptions plus a terracotta altar & a charcoal inscription on ceramic.

location.address: Palazzo Cappellani, Via Gaetano Italia - Palazzolo Acreide (SR)

name: Museo Archeologico di Lentini
description: The collection is arranged across two floors, beginning with Bronze Age material from the surrounding area and then focusing on thematic displays of the Greek and roman city (sacred areas, fortifications etc). The finds are overwhelmingly ceramic, but there is an inscribed lead tablet and some vase inscriptions. The upper floor displays bronze age finds from several sites in the surrounding area and some underwater finds from Punta Castelluccio

name: Antiquarium di Megara Hyblaia
description: CURRENTLY CLOSED

name: Museo Regionale Agostino Pepoli
description: The archaeological collection is housed in one long room that has been subdivided into 4 discrete areas containing 25 cases and a series of open displays. 1 case contains pre- and proto-historic material, 3 are for material from Selinunte, 1 Camarina, 8 Erice, 1 Mozia, 1 Birgi, 1 Lilybaeum, 1 Centuripe, 4 contain material of unknown origin, 1 mixed sites, and then 1 for Punic stamped amphora handles, 1 for Greek and Roman stamped amphora handles, and 1 for Latin epigraphy. In addition there are open displays of material found on the seabed (amphorae, anchor parts, a Roman ram from the Aegadi Islands battle), a large two-sided Latin inscription and a section on Arabic and later Jewish inscriptions

name: Torre de Ligny
description: A small collection in a lovely setting. The roof-top terrace has a pointer to show the location of the Battle of the Aegates islands, and the ground floor has a nice but small collection of pottery and helmets found under the sea in this region. Some lovely sign boards for the tower and underwater archaeology in the area

name: Villa Whitaker
description: Comprehensive collection of Archaeological material discovered at the site of Mozia and in the surrounding area

location.address: Isola di Mozia, Contrada Spagnola, Birgi, 91025 Marsala (TP)

name: Museo archeologico regionale Lilibeo Marsala - Baglio Anselmi
description: Comprehensive collection of Archaeological material discovered at the site of Lilybaeum and in the surrounding area

name: Museo del Satiro Danzante
description: The satyr is beautifully displayed alongside other finds made in the "Sicilian Channel". These consist of amphorae, anchor parts, assorted ceramics, and two "codices" of leather (probably 18th century AD), as well as a single, possibly Punic, inscription, and the Bronze elephant leg.

location.address: Museo Civico, Ex-Collegio Gesuiti, Piazza Plebiscito 91026 - Mazara del Vallo (TP)

name: Museo Civico di Castelvetrano
description: A rich but small collection of finds from the site and area of Selinunte

name: Museo della Preistoria
description: A beautifully displayed collection of predominantly prehistoric material from Contrada Stretta and the surrounding area, displayed in a lovingly restored Norman castle

name: Stabilimento Florio delle Tonnare di Favignana e delle Formiche
description: A small but rich collection of material found on the adjacent seabed.

location.address: Ex Stabilmento Florio delle Tonnare di Favignana e Formica, Via Amendola, 29, 91023 Favignana (TP)

name: Museo Civico Antonino Cordici
description: The archaeological collection consists of a small coin collection, a few catapult/ballista balls, some ceramics (a small prehistoric section) a small bust of venus and an inscription; good display boards with a description of the battle of the Aegates islands. This is the totality of the archaeological collection, which is supplemented by further rooms containing medieval and modern art & arms and weaponry. Further inscriptions are in the entrance to the library of Erice

name: Museo Civico di Marsala
description: The neatly displayed material principally derives from the personal collection of a Librarian of Marsala (Salvatore Struppa) who also become honorary inspector of antiquities of the region. The ceramics mostly derive from early Lilybaeum (4-2 centuries BC) some architectural pieces and uninscribed cinerary urns. A stretch of 5th century AD road has been excavated and is on display in one room, and an entire room is given over to 8 Latin inscriptions from Lilybaeum

location.address: Via Ludovico Anselmi Correale - Complesso Monumentale San Pietro , 91025 Marsala (TP)

name: Mirabilia Urbis
description: A selection of architectural pieces of various dates is scattered on the floor around the outer parts of the church, with no labels or information of any kind. The centre of the church is given over to 6 display cases containing finds from several contrada around Mazara

location.address: Chiesa di San Bartolomeo, Piazza San Bartolomeo, 91026 Mazara del Vallo (TP)

name: Baglio Florio Selinunte
description: A Baglio once belonging to the Florio family has been repurposed as a museum space, with two wings currently in use. The West wing houses results from the recent Marconi excavations focusing on the temples on the Acropolis and their early history. There is plenty of space for expansion. The north wing focuses on the German led excavations in the settlement area. Many information panels complement the comprehensive range of material (architectural, ceramic etc)

location.address: Parco Archeologico di Selinunte, Via Selinunte, Castelvetrano

name: Museo delle Trame Mediterranee della Fondazione Orestiadi
description: A stunning museum mainly given over to Islamic and Modern Art, that begins with a small room containing some archaeological material (Bronze age to 6th-5th century BC). The later material is mainly Greek in origin (Lekythos, cover of a Lekane, kylikes etc) so perhaps from Selinunte, but no provenance is given for any of these pieces

name: Museo Civico di Salemi
description: A series of rooms contain material from Mokarta, Monte Polizzo and the castle in Salemi itself. Nice 13-10th century BC material from Mokarta; indigenous, Elymian and Punic from Monte Polizzo. The material from the castle is well chosen and displayed

name: Castello Barbacane
description: Unknown

name: Museo Preistorico
description: A great teaching collection for prehistoric cultures, with some material from the surrounding area supplemented by finds from Northern and Southern Africa and copies of several famous finds (e.g. Venus of Willendorf) The focus is on the Palaeolithic, and they also use comparative material from e.g. Zulu cultures to illustrate specific points. There is a nice display on the Levanzo grotto and a few other areas. This material was originally in Trapani at the Torre de Ligny, and was moved here when that facility was closed. The collection is Medium in size, but the Sicilian material and non-copies alone would be classed as small

name: Museo del Mare
description: Has been closed on all 3 visits made to date

location.address: Via Savoia 57, 91010 - San Vito Lo Capo (TP)

name: Museo della Tonnara di Bonagia
description: The museum is located on the first and second floor of the tower attached to the Tonnara at Bonagia. It is a museum of tuna fishing, but also contains 11 amphorae and a few lead anchor parts

location.address: P.za Tonnara I - 91010 Tonnara di Bonagia (TP)

name: Museo Regionale Archeologico Pietro Griffo
description: Comprehensive collection of archaeological material discovered at the site of Agrigento and in Agrigento province, organised both by chronology and type across a number of rooms and corridors

location.address: Contrada San Nicola, 12 Valley of the Temples, 92100 - Agrigento (AG)

name: Museo Civico, Agrigento
description: A small archaeological collection: primarily carved lapidary pieces from churches that have been demolished. 4 small cases of ancient pottery from the territory and from a private collection, and a small collection of amphorae found underwater. A fine ethnographic collection on the upper floor

name: Museo Archeologico Palazzo Panitteri
description: Comprehensive collection of archaeological material discovered at the site of Monte Adranone

location.address: Palazzo Panitteri, Piazza Vincenzo Navarro, 92017 - Sambuca di Sicilia (AG)

name: Museo della Storia delle Zolfare
description: An unusual collection of finds, seemingly all chance surface discoveries, from 4th millenium BC to Arabic times, on display in a unique environment that has to be seen to be believed: the roof space between the top floor vaults and the roof of the building

name: Museo Archeologico della Badia
description: The collection has been recently redisplayed and renovated, and is a superb example of the museological tradition in Sicily. Maps and information boards provide context for well chosen pieces from the surrounding region. The first few rooms are organised chronologically and by site, with an occasional focus on particular object categories (e.g. Obsidian). They begin with the Neolithic and proceed through the Bronze age and Archaic periods before the main room (which concentrates on ancient Phintias) which looks at the acropolis, urban topography and domestic quarters. A room underneath the main room displays the famous golden jewellery and coins found in Phintias

name: Casa Pace Palaeo-Christian Antiquarium
description: This collection is now closed and it is not expected to reopen

location.address: Collina dei Templi (Giunone, Concordia e Ercole). Valley of the Temples, 92100 Agrigento (AG)

name: Antiquarium at Herakleia Minoa
description: A small series of display cases contain material exclusively from the site of Heraklea Minoa. Mostly from the necropoleis, but also from the excavated houses. Mostly Archaic and Hellenistic, with some red figure pottery. The key find is a large bone aulos

location.address: Area archeologica e Antiquarium Eraclea Minoa, Contrada Minoa, 92011 - Cattolica Eraclea (AG)

name: Museo Civico di Pisa e Guardi
description: A small collection begins with some 19th century (AD) terracotta figurines and progresses to 3 further rooms containing finds from the surrounding area, with some neolithic and eneolithic and 9-6 century BC material. Some of the best finds from the area are now in the museum in Milena (prior to the formation of this museum, when Sig Palumbo of Milena was inspector for this region). The terracotta house models are particularly nice. Finishes with a carved stone lintel from a Byzantine church. Well lit and displayed, with excellent information panels

name: Museo Comunale Francesco Scaglione
description: A lovingly restored palazzo houses the well-displayed personal collection of the local nobleman, Francesco Scaglione (furniture, paintings, art, archaeological objects, objets d'art, small architectural pieces, coins, medals, butterflies etc. The archaeological material is restricted to three cases: (1) amp; (2) mainly ceramics from 5th-3rd centuries BC but some Roman lamps and a Byzantine piece (3) ancient coins from all over the island. No provenance given for ceramics

name: Antiquarium Kronio
description: A very small collection of material found in the thermal cave complex below the antiquarium, some of which are copies (the originals being in the Regional Archaeological Museum in Agrigento). Two cases: (1) Eneolithic and Neolithic material (2) Greek and Roman. There is a lovely display of the cave complex and another case with the equipment the modern explorers have used in their work

name: Museo Storico (full name: istituzione culturale Federico II)
description: A small collection with a focus on the Portopalo shipwreck, the finds from which are in the adjacent storeroom. There are some neolithic stone blades in one case, but otherwise it is Roman period material

name: Museo Archeologico Salvatore Lauricella
description: Dedicated entirely to finds from the site of Monte Saraceno on the outside of town. Begins with a very small selection of Castelluccio pottery and then moves directly to 7th-6th century BC material. Spread over two large rooms, highlights include a satyr-donkey vase, an Attic vase with a sacrifice scene, an Otre in the shape of a tortoise amp; two Archaic Greek inscriptions. A splendid collection

name: Museo Archeologico di Cianciana
description: A restored courtyard adjacent to a church hosts an info point, a small library and the archaeological museum (which complements the Museo Civico 50m down the road). The collection consists of a selection of the material collected by Dr Johannes Bergemann's survey in the area, together with chance finds previously held in private collections in the town. There is also a small mineralogical collection. Coins, ceramics (various periods) and some small metal implements

name: Museo del Papiro "Corrado Basile"
description: A thoughtfully displayed collection of material relating to the creation and use of Papyri in the ancient world, with a natural focus on Egypt. It is a rich collection, and a lot of care and attention has been put into its display

name: Museo Badia Vecchia
description: Closed. BUT, the Chiesa di San Francesco di Paolo (which hosts a permanent exhibition on Sicilian popular art and traditions) has a small temporary display of material from the Badia Vecchia: several Roman sculptures, some painted plaster fragments and some decorative elements from various ancient buildings. All from Taormina

location.address: Palazzo Badia Vecchia, Via Circonvallazione 30, 98039 - Taormina (ME)

name: Museo regionale interdisciplinare di Messina
description: The collection is focused on finds made within the city of Messina itself (the warship ram from Acqualadroni being one of the only notable exceptions). Beginning with the prehistoric periods (a single case) it progresses through the different areas and periods of the city, focusing at the end on the sculpture and inscriptions. The accompanying boards set the objects into a clear historical context. One of the highlights of the collection is the aforementioned warship ram. Two other objects given prominence are two of the four Oscan inscriptions in the collection, from the time of Mamertine domination. The principle display cases focus on the cemeteries and religious areas of the city. The grounds of the museum contain a number of monuments and architectural pieces (many from the post-medieval city that was destroyed in the 1908 earthquake) but some earlier as well, principally Roman in date

name: Mostra Archeologica di Palazzo Pignatelli
description: There are 2 collections here at the moment (1) one of the most perfect and extensive Malacological collections in the world (2) a neat and modern display of archaeological material (entitled from Village to Palace) excavated in and around Menfi. There is a lot of 10th-13th centuries AD material, but also a lot of Late Roman material from the cemeteries. Mostly ceramics, with few dates, but otherwise lengthy descriptions. It is intended that the building will eventually house other exhibits, in particular the Portopalo shipwreck once it is studied and published.

location.address: Palazzo Pignatelli, Piazza Vittorio Emanuele III, 92013 - Menfi (AG)

name: Museo Archeologico di Sant'Angelo Muxaro
description: A 2-floor museum in a small palazzo. The lower floor hosts a geological collection and the prehistoric material (one small room with a couple of cases). The upper floor contains a series of cases holding material from the Archaic period tombs (11-7 centuries BC) excavated by Orsi et al

location.address: Auberge de Provence, Republic Street, Valletta VLT 1112, Malta

name: Area archeologica di Eloro
description: Site of the ancient settlement of Helorus

name: Area archeologica della Neapolis, Orecchio di Dionisio e Teatro Greco
description: Archaeological park, containing the Greek theatre, altar of Hieron, Roman amphitheatre, and ancient stone quarries.

name: Museo Archeologico Giarratana
description: The collection consists of 2 rooms, one focusing on the site of Contrada Margi, and the other on the site of Terravecchia. A series of finds are displayed in small cases, some of which are quite late (e.g. a particularly nice collection of 10th century AD rings)

location.address: Palazzo Barone, Via XX Settembre, 97010 Giarratana (RG)

name: Museo Civico di Santa Marina Salina
description: A small collection, beautifully displayed in a building constructed specially for it. The majority of the finds are from the Roman Bath at Contrada Barone and the Middle Bronze Age village of Portella

name: Centro Culturale di Rinella (Leni)
description: A small collection of archaeological material found in the area of Leni, principally from the sites of Rinicedda, Val di Chiesa and Punta Megna

name: Antiquarium di Castello Eurialo
description: The antiquarium contains numerous information panels and a small collection of objects recovered during the various excavations campaigns carried out in the region of the Castello. The finds are disparate in nature, ranging from carved stones (including a ?marble? sundial), coins, a Hellenistic Iron helmet with bronze studs, a roof tile, small ceramics and a large collection of arrowheads. A carved relief of a catapult is given pride of place. No inscriptions are currently displayed in the antiquarium, but a monumental text is located nearby.

location.address: Contrada Santa Maria delle Palate, Tusa, ME

name: Museo Civico "Don G. Guarneri"
description: The museum is housed in a 16th century monastery, and is arranged across rooms. The first room looks at sites from around the area (Terravecchia and Monte Riparato). The second room has later material from the site of Caltavuturo vecchio. The third room is dedicated to Monte Riparato (small finds, mosaic, Greek inscription) some 7th century BC, but mainly 4th and 3rd, and some Samian ware. The final room is given over to the numismatic collection, the focal point of which is a Republican coin hoard found in the area

location.address: Museo Civico "Don G. Guarneri", Piazza San Francesco n�1, Caltavuturo, 90022 PA

name: Area archeologica di Megara Hyblaea
description: Site of a Greek colony founded 728 BC, destroyed 483 BC, redeveloped in the fourth century BC and sacked by Rome in 213 BC.

name: Biblioteca Civica "Vito Carvini"
description: The entrance hall to the civic library in the municipio hosts a small collection of sculpture and inscriptions, 2 of which are ancient

location.address: Via Vittorio Emanuele, 1, 91016 Erice TP, Italy
75 Varick Street, 11th Fl New York, NY 10013
The Fitzwilliam Museum Trumpington Street, Cambridge CB2 1RB
Heberden Coin Room Ashmolean Museum Beaumont Street Oxford OX1 2PH

name: Area Archeologica dell�antica Apollonia
description: Site of Ancient Apollonia

name: Museo Civico di Niscemi
description: A very large and rich well-displayed civic museum with a strong focus on the lifestyle and life experience of people in this region in the 19th and 20th centuries. A large natural history section includes a single case related to human interaction with the environment, half of which is archaeological. There is some Castelluciano period pottery, and some stamped Roman pottery from a small settlement at the foot of the hill of Niscemi

name: Museo Civico di Belpasso
description: A 3 room museum, the first 2 of which are ethno-anthropological with a strong section on WWII. The 3rd room is devoted to the archaeology of the area with 5 display cases of finds from Valcorrente (Neolithic and Chalcolithic), Grammena (Hellenistic to Late Roman & Byzantine). Some nice finds and good explanatory material.

location.address: Casa Giallo Russo-Giusti, Via II Retta Levante 173, 95032 - Belpasso (CT)

name: Museo Archeologico Santi Furnari di Tripi
description: The neatly-curated collection derives entirely from the Hellenistic necropolis of ancient Abakainon on the outskirts of the modern town of Tripi. The high acidity of the soil has stripped many of the ceramics of their surface decoration, and there is an understandable focus on the metal items (gold and iron) and the stone stele and moulded bases. The collection is arranged over 4 rooms and one corridor on two levels of a restored palazzo, and is equipped with a number of IT panels

name: Museo Archeologico Pirro Marconi
description: This well-displayed museum is dedicated to the so-called Temple of Victory at Himera and the recently excavated West Cemetery material. A well-made video introduces the history of the site and focuses in particular on the two battles. Excellent illustrations and information boards contextualise all of the finds. The large building has been subdivided into discrete rooms by low walls and panels, and the superb material from the cemeteries are juxtaposed neatly with architectural elements from the Temple. The displays include material from the medieval and modern strata that overlaid the Temple

location.address: Contrada Buonfornello (PA) On the plain next to the temple

name: Antiquarium di Roccamena
description: A single room in a larger building, all the material derives from Soprintendenza excavations at the site of Monte Maranfusa just outside of the present town. 7 cases with some amphorae etc on open view. Mostly ceramics (amphroae, household ware, loom weights) but also a case of metallic small finds (bronze astragalos, clothing fibulae etc)

name: Villa Reimann
description: A single case of archaeological material found by Christiane Reimann on her property, on display in one of the ground floor rooms. Storage vessels, coins, miniature terracotta figurines, oil lamps, tile fragments etc

name: Museo Civico di Mazara del Vallo
description: A museum devoted to amphorae found in the waters off Mazara del Vallo, spread across a series of rooms in the ex-Jesuit monastery, in one of which a small excavation has been opened, which is juxtaposed with some of the amphorae

location.address: Piazza del Plebiscito 2, 91026 - Mazara del Vallo (TP)

name: Museo "La Memoria del Mediterraneo"
description: The Ground and first floor of the castle has been renovated as a small museum, with separate entrance to each level. The first floor is given over to the history of the town and area; room 1 a brief history; room 2 photographs of archaeological finds from the Grotta del Cavallo of Monte Inici and some fossils; room 3 has a series of cases and open exhibits of archaeological material found principally in the sea (amphorae, anchor parts, pot covers, a terracotta figure) mainly of 2nd BC to 5 AD

location.address: Castello Arabo-Normanno, Piazza Castello, 91014 - Castellammare del Golfo (TP)

name: Museo della Preistoria del Valle del Belice
description: A beautiful collection displayed in 3 rooms with an ante-room containing panels giving geological and chronological background. The collection is principally the lithic material found in the Valle del Belice, dating to 300,000 BC to 1000 BC. The material is the best of its kind in Sicily; the final room has 2 Roman amphorae, a case of proto-Elymian ceramics, and then 2 cases of late Roman finds from a nearby site including an Arabic sugar pot (this is not officially open, so should be listed as such)

name: Antiquarium del Mare Daniele Valenti
description: A well displayed collection of finds made in the waters of Agrigento province. One focus is on the 17-18th century AD wreck at Bottazza, but there are also ancient remains such as amphorae, a Montefortino type helmet, and some finds (mostly ceramic, but also a ring-key) from the mouth of the Akragas river at San Leone

location.address: Collina dei Templi (Giunone, Concordia e Ercole). Valley of the Temples, 92100 Agrigento (AG)

name: Hotel-Museum Costazzurra
description: The collection has been bought on the international antiquities market with the permission of the Soprintendente, and is mainly displayed in the lobby of the hotel. Other pieces are on display in one bedroom, with further pieces due to be displayed in other rooms currently under completion. The few items are well displayed, with excellent labels, and consists of numerous ceramics (including red and black figure examples, and a terracotta figurine) as well as a bone gaming dice, arrow heads and a bronze dagger

location.address: Hotel Costazzurra, Via delle Viole 2, 92100 - San Leone (AG)

name: Necropoli di Abakainon
description: Partially uncovered Hellenistic necropolis

name: Antiquarium della Pontificia Commissione di Archeologia Sacra, Siracusa
description: Antiquarium of the Pontificia Commissione di Archeologia Sacra, Ispettorato per le catacombe della Sicilia Orientale; not currently open to the public.

location.address: Antiquarium della Pontificia Commissione di Archeologia Sacra, Ispettorato per le catacombe della Sicilia Orientale, via Augusto von Platen 34/A-36

name: Museo Civico di Montelepre
description: http://www.montelepre.gov.it/index.php/la-citta/musei-e-monumenti/94-museo-civico

name: Area archeologica di Tindari
description: Archaeological site of the ancient settlement of Tyndaris, occupied from c.400 BCE through to the 9th century CE

location.address: Via del Teatro Greco, Localita Tindari, ME

name: Parco Archeologico di Selinunte
description: Site of ancient Selinus, a Greek colonial foundation of the 7th cent. BCE, occupied until the C3 BCE

location.address: Piazzale Iole Bovio Marconi, 1, Fraz. Marinella di Selinunte, 91022 - Castelvetrano (TP)

name: Area archeologica Castello Eurialo
description: Site of the primary fortifications of the urban defences of Syracuse, later fifth to third centuries BCE

name: depot of the Zurich Ietas excavation
description: Excavation stores

name: Area archeologica del Monte Iato
description: Site of ancient Ietas

location.address: Contrada Perciata, San Giuseppe Jato, 90040 San Cipirello PA, Italy

name: Area archeologica di Morgantina
description: Site of ancient Morgantina

location.address: Case Barbaro - contrada Barbaro S.R. 22, 91013 Calatafimi

name: Soprintendenza Beni Culturali e Ambientali di Messina
description: Offices and stores of the provincial archaeological authority

location.address: Via Panoramica Valle dei Templi, 31 92100, Agrigento
